text: mr. president we're standing here on
Midway which is the site of the decisive
Allied victory during you know World War
2 in the Pacific battle you mentioned
that when you think about climate change
and rallying the nation to try to
confront what is really an unseen
challenge how do you do that how do you
galvanize the public around something
that doesn't seem to have an immediate
impact the way bombs or bullets did
during World War two
well it's a great question part of what
we've been trying to do is to provide
some visual aid to understanding what's
happening when we come here being able
to highlight the incredible beauty of a
place like this but also recognizing
that if oceans continue to get warmer
that a lot of the marine species here
could be affected and that ultimately
that's gonna have an impact on human
populations I think the average American
wants to see us tackle these problems
it's not at the very top of their list
but if they feel as if through a smart
policy they can continue to see a rising
standard of living and their economic
concerns addressed while still helping
address climate change that's gonna be
the direction that they want us to go in
and as you look toward a few months down
the road when you're no longer in the
White House how much how big of a part
of your life and your work will climate
change feed how do you see yourself
playing a role in the debate why do you
I do I think this is something that I
will continue to be concerned about my
hope is maybe as ex-president I can have
a little more influence on some of my
Republican friends who I think up until
now have been resistant to the science
there's no reason why this should be a
a partisan issue this is something that
all of us we're gonna have to tackle and
maybe I get a little more of a hearing
if I'm not occupying a political office
well any advice for your successor on
how to do that as president how to
really get the debate around this to be
a less partisan one III think you stay
with it we have to have confidence in
our ability to solve these problems
we've been it before there's no reason
why we can do this
you
